details: The story of the legendary scavenger who discovered a long-lost treasure in the ruins is one that has been passed down through many generations. It is said that this brave adventurer stumbled upon a hidden chamber deep within the ruins of the lost civilization, filled with priceless artifacts and treasures beyond his wildest dreams. The scavenger made off with as much of the loot as he could carry and returned to the enclave a hero, showered with praise and admiration. To this day, the scavenger's exploits continue to inspire young adventurers to set out into the dangerous wilderness in search of their own fortune.

The myth of the cursed statue that brings misfortune to those who touch it is one that chills the bones of even the bravest souls in the enclave. Legend has it that a group of scavengers once stumbled upon a strange carved statue deep within the ruins of the lost civilization. They took the statue back to the enclave with them, not realizing the terrible curse that it carried. From that day on, the community was plagued with misfortune and disaster, until finally a wise elder realized the truth and ordered the statue to be cast into the Cursed Well, never to be seen again. To this day, some residents still swear that they can feel the statue's malevolent presence lurking in the shadows, waiting for its next victim.

The legend of the Great Flood that destroyed the previous settlement before the current one was founded is a cautionary tale that serves as a reminder of the fragility of life in the enclave. It is said that a terrible storm descended upon the mountain, bringing with it a deluge of rain and wind that battered the settlement and washed away everything in its path. Homes were destroyed, families were torn apart, and many lives were lost. But through sheer tenacity and determination, the survivors managed to rebuild and establish the current settlement, vowing to always be prepared for whatever nature may throw their way.

The tale of the lost child who wandered into the wilderness but was saved by a pack of wolves is a heartwarming story that speaks to the resilience and resourcefulness of the residents of the enclave. It is said that a young child once wandered away from the safety of the community and became lost in the dense forest surrounding the mountain. As night fell and the child grew increasingly desperate, a pack of wolves emerged from the darkness and began to circle him. But instead of attacking, the wolves protected the child through the night, keeping him warm and safe until he was finally discovered the next morning. From that day on, the wolves were considered to be sacred protectors of the enclave, and their howls could often be heard echoing through the mountains at night.

The rumor of a hidden cult within the community who worship a secret deity is one that has been whispered about in hushed tones for many years. Some say that a group of residents have taken to worshipping a mysterious and unknown deity, conducting secretive rituals and ceremonies in the dead of night. Others claim that the cult is nothing more than a paranoid delusion, fueled by the isolation and precarious existence of the enclave. But despite the rumors, no concrete evidence of the supposed cult has ever been uncovered, leaving many residents to wonder if it truly exists or if it is simply a figment of their collective imagination.

The joke about the community's obsession with recycling everything, even old socks and broken crockery is one that highlights the admirable resourcefulness and self-sufficiency of the enclave. In a place where resources are scarce and every item is valuable, the residents have learned to make do with what they have and to salvage and reuse everything possible. They are known throughout the region for their innovative recycling techniques, and visitors are often amazed to see how they can turn even the most mundane objects into useful tools and materials. The joke is a lighthearted way of acknowledging this impressive feat, and it serves as a reminder of the incredible resilience and ingenuity of the residents of the enclave.

the myth of the cursed statue that brings misfortune to those who touch it
the legend of the Great Flood that destroyed the previous settlement before the current one was founded
the tale of the lost child who wandered into the wilderness but was saved by a pack of wolves
the rumor of a hidden cult within the community who worship a secret deity
the joke about the community's obsession with recycling everything, even old socks and broken crockery

details: The Great Hall is a central gathering place for the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, where residents come together for communal potluck dinners or important meetings. The hall is a simple but spacious wooden structure, with a large hearth at one end where food is cooked and served. Long wooden tables and benches provide seating for everyone, and residents take turns volunteering to prepare and serve meals. Despite the precarious existence of the community, they remain resilient and resourceful, relying on their communal bonds to support each other through difficult times. The atmosphere in the Great Hall is one of warmth and camaraderie, with laughter and conversation filling the air.

The Old Temple is a hauntingly beautiful half-ruined structure that serves as a place of pilgrimage for outsiders who come seeking the wisdom of the non-gendered deity worshiped by the Enclave. The temple was originally built by the lost civilization that once thrived in the area, but now its crumbling walls and faded murals speak of a bygone era. Inside the temple, residents come to pray and make offerings to the Old One, seeking guidance and protection in their precarious existence. Visitors who come to the temple are often struck by its eerie beauty and the sense of history and mystery that it embodies.

The Cursed Well is a deep well that has long been rumored to bring bad luck to those who drink from it. Despite this reputation, the well is an essential source of fresh water for the Enclave, which has no other reliable source nearby. The well's waters are cold and clear, bubbling up from deep underground. It is said that the curse on the well comes from the lost civilization that once lived in the area, and that the Enclave's founders chose to settle here despite the curse because they had nowhere else to go. Still, many Enclave residents avoid drinking from the well if they can, fearing the curse's power.

The High Watchtower is a tall stone structure built on a promontory overlooking the Enclave's territory. The tower is manned day and night by volunteers from the community who keep watch for incoming visitors or enemies. Its height gives a commanding view of the surrounding countryside, and its interior is equipped with telescopes and other instruments to help the watchers identify threats or opportunities. The tower also serves as a warning beacon in times of danger, signaling to other nearby communities that help is needed. Despite its importance, the High Watchtower is a simple structure, with only a few rooms and basic furnishings.

The Barracks is a fortified building where residents store weapons and prepare for battle against raiders or slavers who prey on the Enclave's vulnerability. The Barracks is a sturdy stone structure, heavily guarded day and night by residents armed with bows, arrows, and spears. Inside, racks of weapons line the walls, and training dummies and targets fill the open floor space. Volunteers take turns drilling in combat tactics and honing their skills, readying themselves for the next attack. While the Barracks is a somber and serious place, its importance to the community cannot be overstated.

The Scrap Yard is an open-air storage area filled with metal scraps salvaged from the ruins of the lost civilization. The yard is a disorganized jumble of discarded metal objects, but to the Enclave residents, each scrap represents a potential tool or weapon. Residents who are skilled at metalworking can often be found here, hammering and shaping bits of scrap into useful objects like knives, arrowheads, and farming implements. Despite being surrounded by decay and ruin, the Scrap Yard is a bright spot in the Enclave, full of industriousness and ingenuity.
architecture.global_view: A small community nestled within the ruins of a lost civilization, surrounded by towering mountains and dense forest.
architecture.global_view_detailed: The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones is a hauntingly beautiful place, with crumbling ruins and overgrown foliage vying for space with makeshift wooden shelters and scavenged metal. The community is nestled deep within the heart of the mountains, surrounded by dense forests and rocky terrain that provide both protection and hardship. Although the settlement has grown up amidst the ruins of a lost civilization, it has taken on a character all its own, with communal meals held in the Great Hall, prayer and meditation at the Old Temple, and constant vigilance from the High Watchtower. Life is precarious in the Enclave, but the residents have learned to rely on one another and their own resourcefulness to survive.
keywords: The Great Hall, where communal dinners and meetings are held
The Old Temple, a half-destroyed temple to the Old One that has become a place of pilgrimage for outsiders
The Cursed Well, a deep well that is said to bring bad luck to those who drink from it
The High Watchtower, a lookout post used to spy on incoming visitors or enemies

The Scrap Yard, where metal scraps are stored and recycled for various uses

details: Memorial Day for Lost Civilization: The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones holds a solemn ceremony every year to remember the lost civilization that once thrived in the area. The community members come together to reflect on the past and pay tribute to those who perished in the ancient ruins. This day serves as a reminder of how precarious their existence is, and how they must remain resilient and resourceful to survive in this hauntingly beautiful but treacherous land. The Enclave's communal bonds are strengthened by this yearly ritual, and their determination to preserve their way of life is reaffirmed.

Potluck Dinners: The Enclave's culture revolves around sharing, and one of the most beloved customs is the potluck dinners held on special occasions. Every family contributes a dish to the communal table, and the food is shared equally among everyone present. These gatherings are an opportunity to celebrate their self-sufficient lifestyle and showcase their improvisation skills. They also promote social cohesion as everyone gathers around the table, telling stories and jokes while enjoying the delicious homemade food.

Community Watch: The Enclave is isolated, with no contact with the outside world except during rare trading visits. Thus, they have established a community watch system to defend their territory against bandits and raiders. Every member takes turns standing guard at the High Watchtower, scanning the horizon for any signs of danger. The watch duty is taken seriously by all, for they know that their survival depends on it.

Ritualistic Scavenging Expeditions: The Enclave's main source of resources is the scrap metal they salvage from the ruins of the lost civilization. To ensure that they have enough supplies to last throughout the year, they organize annual scavenging expeditions. These are highly ritualistic events, with a chosen few venturing into the ruins under the guidance of the community's spiritual leaders. The scavengers believe that the spirits of the lost civilization watch over them in these expeditions, guiding them to the most valuable scraps. The Enclave's survival depends on their ability to scavenge efficiently, so these expeditions are taken very seriously.

Daily Communal Prayer to the Old One: The Enclave is a religious community, with a unique local belief system centered around a non-gendered deity known as the Old One. Every day, the community members gather in the Great Hall for communal prayer and reflection. They give thanks to the Old One for providing them with food, water, shelter, and protection. The daily prayer is a reminder of the Enclave's humble origins as refugees seeking safety, and their deep gratitude for their communal bonds and shared resources.

Trading with Outsiders During Rare Visits: Although the Enclave is self-sufficient, they do trade with outsiders during rare visits from nearby trading posts. These trading expeditions are highly organized, with a designated team responsible for negotiating with the traders and deciding which resources to acquire. The Enclave's culture of recycling and hoarding makes them shrewd negotiators, and they always seek to obtain the best possible deals. The trading visits are also an opportunity for the Enclave to showcase their practical skills and unique culture to outsiders.
keywords: daily communal prayer to the Old One
trading with outsiders during rare visits

description.description: Deep within the heart of the formidable mountains lies The Forgotten Enclave, a resilient community eking out an existence within the vast ruins of a once-majestic city. Cut off from the outside world, these settlers and beggars have embraced their precarious existence, fashioning crude shelters amidst crumbling architecture and overgrown foliage. Silent whispers of a lost civilization echo through the labyrinthine streets, while weathered statues and dilapidated structures stand as testament to a grandeur long past. Life in The Forgotten Enclave is a constant struggle for survival, as residents scavenge for meager resources, relying on their resourcefulness and communal bonds to endure within this hauntingly beautiful, forgotten realm.

details: The occasional traders from nearby small communities or the empire bring valuable goods that the enclave cannot produce themselves. These traders often travel to the enclave during the harvest festival to barter for fur and leather goods or wild berries, mushrooms, and herbs. The traders also bring news of other nearby communities, which helps the enclave stay informed about threats and opportunities. However, the enclave's self-sufficiency means they do not rely on these traders too much. They see them as potential allies rather than saviors. The traders sometimes also share stories of their own adventures and experiences with the people of the enclave, widening their worldview and giving them new ideas for future projects. It is important for the enclave to maintain these relations with the traders to keep their access to external resources.

Infrequent visits from travelers seeking shelter have become a common occurrence in the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. The community allows travelers to take temporary refuge, which allows the enclave members to learn about the outside world and its customs. Sometimes, the travelers turn out to be traders, who bring news from other parts of the continent. The enclave members often try to persuade the travelers to settle in their community, but most of them prefer to move on. The travelers who stay longer may be invited to work with the people of the enclave or to participate in their daily rituals and traditions. The people of the enclave are careful when accepting outsiders into their community, but their hospitality has earned them a good reputation among travelers.

Bandits and slavers pose a serious threat to the enclave and their isolation makes them vulnerable to attacks. The people of the enclave have established a watchtower at the entrance of their village to watch the roads leading to the enclave. When raiders approach, they activate defensive strategies involving barricading themselves indoors, preparing weapons, and sending scouts to spy on the enemy's movements. They also have an alarm system that alerts the entire community of an incoming attack. When bandits or slavers manage to enter the enclave, they are met with fierce resistance from the well-armed and determined residents. However, these raids have also led to collective trauma among the people of the enclave, and some residents suffer from PTSD as a result of surviving such attacks. The Enclave is constantly on guard against these threats, and it is a testament to their resilience that they have managed to survive for so long despite the odds against them.
keywords: occasional traders from nearby small communities or the empire
infrequent visits from travelers seeking shelter
bandits and slavers who prey on the community's isolation and vulnerability

details: The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones was founded by a group of refugees who fled from a war-torn nation seeking safety more than a generation ago. The group found themselves in the harsh mountain environment, and initially struggled to establish a sustainable lifestyle. The founders had no idea what lie ahead, but they were determined to survive and thrive, whatever the cost may be. They had to start from scratch, and this was incredibly difficult. Hunting and gathering was a challenge, as was finding reliable sources of water. Over time, they learned how to use what was available in their environment to their advantage. They started patterning with each other and learning to share whatever resources they had. This is how the foundation of the community was built.

After a few years of surviving and growing, the people of The Enclave discovered the ruins of a lost civilization that they decided to repurpose for their own use. This was a game-changer for the community. They were able to use the scraps of metal and other materials they found in the ruins to build more permanent structures and to create more efficient tools. It was this resourcefulness that allowed them to start developing the communal lifestyle that they still enjoy today. Unfortunately, some of the scavengers who ventured too deep into the ruins never came back – it was rumored that the ruins were haunted by the ghosts of the lost civilization, and this lent an air of haunting beauty to the place that could never be shaken.

The Enclave has had its fair share of challenges. At one point in time, a despotic leader tried to impose his will on the community. He believed in a rigid hierarchy with himself at the top. This didn't sit well with the free-spirited people of the enclave. Ultimately, he was removed from power and the people returned to their communal way of life. They had seen the dangers of centralized power and didn't want to see their community destroyed by it. They knew the dangers of depending on a single leader too heavily, and they were determined not to fall into that trap again.

Bandits and slavers have long been a problem for The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. The isolation and vulnerability of the community made them an easy target for these ruthless raiders. The people of the enclave learned to defend themselves over time, but they never got used to the constant fear of attack. It was always in the back of their minds, a reminder of the precarious existence that they had chosen when they decided to live apart from the rest of the world.

In addition to fighting off bandits and slavers, The Enclave has had to deal with natural disasters as well. One such disaster was a devastating flood that destroyed half of the community's shelters. Those who survived were forced to start from scratch once again. For months afterwards, the community struggled to rebuild, but they did so with their usual resilience and resourcefulness. As a result, they developed new communal bonds, and their society became even more tightly-knit than before.

Despite the challenges faced by The Enclave, they have continued to thrive. Over the years, they have become known for their unique customs and beliefs. They believe in a single god, a non-gendered deity that watches over them. They also don't allow any undead within their community, believing them to be a threat to the living. Their belief system is relatively isolated from the rest of the world. However, they do have contact with other small communities and traders from the bigger empire. This has allowed them to establish a trading route, which has helped them to maintain their self-sufficient lifestyle. They continue to seek out the secrets of the lost civilization and are always on the lookout for new resources to help them survive.

The people of The Enclave have faced many challenges and difficulties in their time. But they have always remained resilient and resourceful, using their communal bonds to overcome the harshest obstacles. They know that their precarious existence is not ideal, but they wouldn't trade it for anything. They are proud of who they are, and they will do whatever it takes to defend themselves, their traditions, and their way of life.
keywords: founded by a group of refugees seeking safety from a war-torn nation
discovered the ruins of the lost civilization and repurposed them for their own use
struggled to establish a sustainable lifestyle in the harsh mountain environment
returned to communal living after a failed experiment with a despotic leader
faced repeated raids by bandits and slavers
survived a devastating flood that destroyed half their shelters

details: The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones relies heavily on scrap metal obtained from the ruins of the lost civilization to create basic tools and equipment. The ruins, once an advanced and powerful civilization, have been stripped clean by scavengers long ago. However, the community has managed to scavenge enough metal scraps to keep their basic tools functioning. The scraps are melted down in a small furnace and cast into simple shapes. The constant need for repairs and maintenance means that the community has developed a high level of skill in creating and repairing metal tools.

The community forages for wild berries, mushrooms, and herbs in the surrounding area. Fruits and vegetables are scarce in the harsh mountain environment, so the people rely heavily on these wild foods for sustenance. They have learned to identify the edible plants and avoid the poisonous ones. Gathering these foods is a communal activity, and the harvest is shared among all members of the community. The abundance of these foods varies depending on the season, and the people must be strategic in their harvesting to ensure that they have enough to last through the winter months.

The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones has a freshwater spring that provides drinking water for the entire community. The water is clean and pure, safe for consumption without any treatment. The importance of this spring cannot be overstated, as water is scarce in the surrounding area. The community has taken steps to protect the spring and ensure that it remains clean and accessible. The water is also used for cooking and bathing, and the community is careful not to waste a single drop.

The people of the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones hunt and trap local animals to obtain fur and leather, which are used to create warm clothing, blankets, and footwear. These resources are vital for survival during the harsh winter months, when temperatures can dip well below freezing. Hunting and trapping are communal activities, and the people make use of every part of the animal they catch. The community has also learned the art of tanning and curing hides to make them more durable and long-lasting.

The people of the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones share tools and equipment, which is critical given the scarcity of resources. Tools and equipment are carefully maintained and repaired to ensure their longevity. Every member of the community is expected to contribute to this communal effort, and those who do not are seen as selfish and uncooperative. The community has developed a strong sense of trust and cooperation, which is essential for their survival in this isolated and precarious environment.

The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones relies on crude shelters made of wood and stone to protect themselves from the elements. These shelters are constructed from the materials available in the surrounding area and are designed to be simple and functional rather than aesthetically pleasing. The people do their best to keep these shelters in good repair, but they are vulnerable to damage from harsh weather conditions. As a result, the community has developed a strategy of building multiple shelters in different locations to ensure that they always have a place to go in case of a disaster.

The people of the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones make their own clothing and blankets from the materials available in the surrounding area. They use fur and leather obtained from local animals and use weaving and sewing techniques to create warm and durable clothing. The clothing is plain and utilitarian, but it serves its purpose well. Each member of the community is responsible for making their own clothing, but communal efforts are also made to create blankets and other items that are shared among the entire community.

The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones engages in bartering with nearby trading posts when they have a surplus of resources. They trade scrap metal, furs, and dried herbs for goods such as salt, spices, and luxury items like fabric or jewelry. Trading is infrequent and must be carefully planned to ensure that the people get the best possible deals. Given the isolation of the community, the traders are always quick to take advantage of any opportunity to make a profit, and the people must be vigilant to ensure that they do not get ripped off.
keywords: crude shelters made of wood and stone

details: Every year, the members of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones embark on a scavenging expedition to the ruins of the lost civilization. This expedition is one of the most significant events of the year, as it provides the community with metal scraps and other resources that are hard to come by in their isolated mountain location. The expedition is perilous, as the ruins are dangerous and unpredictable, and bandits and wild animals pose a constant threat. However, the community is resilient and resourceful, and they always manage to return with enough supplies to last them through the harsh winter months.

The harvest festival is one of the few times of the year when the community comes together to celebrate their self-sufficient way of life. The festival is held in the Great Hall, where members share potluck meals made with the fruits of their labor. Everyone contributes to the feast, whether it be wild berries, mushrooms, or herbs gathered from the surrounding forest, or vegetables grown in the communal gardens. The festival is also a time for reflection, as members remember those who have been lost and give thanks for the bounty that has been bestowed upon them.

The community of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones follows a unique tradition of communal prayer during major celestial events. During these times, all members of the community gather at the Old Temple to sing hymns and offer prayers to the Old One, their non-gendered deity. These events take place during solstices, equinoxes, and other significant celestial events, and serve as a reminder of their communal bonds and shared beliefs.

A new group of refugees seeking safety has emerged on the outskirts of the community. These newcomers are weary and frightened, having fled from a nearby village that has fallen victim to bandit raids. The members of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones welcome them with open arms, sharing what little they have and offering them shelter from the raiders. The community knows all too well the perils of living in isolation, and they are determined to help these newcomers settle in and establish a new life in their midst.

The death of a beloved leader has rocked the community of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. The leader, a wise and respected elder, had been instrumental in helping the community survive and thrive in their precarious existence. His passing has left a void in the hearts of all who knew him. In the aftermath of his death, the community must come together to elect a new leader and continue the work that he helped start.

The community of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones is reeling from a devastating slaver raid. The raiders came in the dead of night, taking many of the community's young people and leaving destruction and despair in their wake. The community is now faced with the daunting task of rebuilding, both physically and emotionally. They must also come up with a plan for defending themselves against future attacks, lest they fall victim to the raiders once again.
keywords: annual scavenging expedition to the lost civilization ruins
harvest festival celebrating the community's self-sufficiency
communal prayers during major celestial events
emerging of a new group of refugees seeking safety
death of a beloved leader and the subsequent election of a new one
dealing with the aftermath of a slaver raid

anecdotes: Cobb once saved the life of a young girl who had wandered too far into the ruins. He risked his own life to retrieve her and bring her back to the safety of the community.

During a particularly harsh winter, when the group's supplies were running low, Cobb came up with a plan to ration the food and distribute it fairly among the members. His practical approach helped the community survive the winter without any casualties.
Cobb Denby.description: Cobb Denby, the current leader of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, is a curmudgeonly and stubborn man fiercely protective of his community. He has seen the community through many tough times and has managed to keep them safe and prosperous for many years. While he can be pessimistic at times, his practical nature and strong leadership have kept the group together. Cobb's relationship with his family is strong, but he finds it difficult to manage his son Kerr's impulsive nature. Cobb also secretly struggles with alcoholism, but he does not let it affect his leadership or decision-making skills.

family.relationship: distant from his father and thinks his brother Kerr is too impulsive

Cobb Denby.habits: Cobb has a habit of starting his day with a cup of strong coffee before attending to his daily duties. He takes his job very seriously and can often be found working long hours in the Rusty Raiders. During his free time, he enjoys reading, particularly historical texts about the lost civilization that once inhabited the area.
Cobb Denby.history: Cobb was born and raised in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones and comes from a long line of community leaders. His grandfather, Baen Denby, served as the eldest member of the group before passing the mantle to Cobb's father. When his father passed away, it was only natural that Cobb would take up the role of leader. He has been in the position for over a decade now and has seen the community through many challenges and hardships. Despite the precarious existence of The Enclave, Cobb has managed to keep the community safe and prosperous through his resourceful leadership.

anecdotes: Geduve once saved the life of a young orphan who was scavenging for food in the wilderness. She took the child under her wing and raised him as her own, teaching him the trade and making him a respected member of The Hopefuls' Alliance.

When the community was hit by a severe storm that destroyed most of the crops, Geduve rallied the inhabitants and led them on a scavenging mission to find supplies in nearby settlements. Thanks to her resourcefulness and leadership, they managed to survive the harsh winter that followed.
Geduve is known for her fair treatment of everyone, regardless of their status or background. She once famously said "We are all equal in the eyes of the single god."
Geduve Steadfast.clothes: leather apron over a sturdy skirt and blouse
Geduve Steadfast.description: Geduve Steadfast is an old dwarf woman who has been living in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones since birth. Her parents were among the founders of the community, and she has always been a respected leader and a mother figure to the inhabitants. Geduve is tough, fair, resourceful and practical, traits that have allowed her to lead the co-op at The Hopefuls' Alliance, the main trading post in the community. She always wears a leather apron over a sturdy skirt and blouse, and has a short, silver bob and blue eyes which give her a determined look. Despite her age, Geduve is still very pretty and has a hauntingly beautiful aura that makes people feel safe around her.

family.relationship: respected leader, mother figure

Geduve Steadfast.habits: Geduve has a habit of always making sure everyone has a say in how things are run. She believes that a communal bond is necessary for survival in their precarious existence. She is also very organized and structured, preferring cooperative ways of doing things. Geduve is a master trader and spends most of her time at The Hopefuls' Alliance, overseeing the trading activities and making sure everything runs smoothly.
Geduve Steadfast.history: Geduve was born and raised in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, and has never left it since. She learned the trade from her parents and became a skilled trader herself, eventually leading the co-op at The Hopefuls' Alliance. Her leadership skills have been crucial for the survival of the community, and she has always been dedicated to maintaining the communal bonds and ensuring the safety and security of the inhabitants. Geduve is a devout follower of the single god worshipped in the community, a non-gendered deity that forbids the undead and is different from the big empire's beliefs. She is also well-versed in the local beliefs of the unique continent. Despite her tough exterior, Geduve is hiding a secret: her parents were among the founders of the community, and her legacy is both a burden and a source of pride for her.

job.description: leader of the co-op
job.quote: "We'll make sure everyone has a say in how we run things"
job.relations: leading the co-op
job.working_clothes: brown cloak with gold trim, red boots

Geduve Steadfast.name: Geduve
plot: Geduve has been noticing some changes in the behavior of some of the inhabitants of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. She suspects that there might be a group of people who are trying to sabotage the communal bonds and sow discord among the community. Her goal is to uncover this plot and stop it before it causes irreparable damage.

The prosperity of The Hopefuls' Alliance has been declining lately, and Geduve is worried that they might not have enough resources to survive the harsh winter that is coming. Her goal is to find new trading partners and increase the variety of goods they trade in order to ensure the community's survival.

Geduve has recently received word that her niece, who lives in a nearby settlement, is in trouble and needs her help. Her goal is to leave The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones temporarily and travel to the settlement to provide assistance.

A group of adventurers has arrived in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, looking for a guide to take them to a lost civilization rumored to be nearby. Geduve sees an opportunity to increase the community's prosperity by offering her services as a guide, but she is also hesitant because she knows that the lost civilization is dangerous and could lead to the community's downfall if not handled properly.
Geduve Steadfast.quote: "We'll make sure everyone has a say in how we run things"

relationship.Bailey Brisbane: Bailey is Gale Brisbane's daughter and a young apprentice trader at The Hopefuls' Alliance. Geduve sees her as a promising young talent and often offers her guidance and advice as she learns the trade.
relationship.Darlave Softshadow: Geduve has taken Darlave under her wing and is mentoring her as an apprentice trader at The Hopefuls' Alliance. She sees potential in Darlave and is proud of her progress.
relationship.Gwen Brisbane: Gwen is Gale Brisbane's wife and a nurturing matriarch who always looks out for her family. Geduve sees her as a respected elder and often seeks her advice when dealing with family matters.
relationship.Jordan Hurst: Jordan is a kind and wise member of the community, and Geduve sees him as a friend and confidante. She often turns to him for emotional support and advice in times of need.
relationship.Juliana Fullet: Juliana is a wise and loving matriarch who is respected by all. Geduve sees her as a role model and often seeks her guidance when dealing with difficult situations.
relationship.Niall Vain: Niall is one of the senior traders at The Hopefuls' Alliance and a respected member of the community. Geduve sees him as a trusted advisor and often seeks his counsel when making important decisions.
relationship.Una Bradner: Geduve and Una have been working together at The Hopefuls' Alliance for many years. They share a mutual respect and friendship, and often rely on each other's skills and expertise.

Geduve Steadfast.secret: her parents were among the founders of the community
Geduve Steadfast.working_clothes: brown cloak with gold trim, red boots

anecdotes: Gilihalki once saved a group of scavengers from an ambush by a band of raiders. The scavengers were so grateful that they gave him a rare artifact from the old empire as a token of their appreciation.

During a guard shift, Gilihalki encountered a lone traveler who was lost and injured. He helped the traveler and brought them back to The Enclave, where they were able to recuperate. The traveler turned out to be a scholar who had important information about the unique continent and its history. The scholar shared this knowledge with Gilihalki, and he was fascinated by what he learned.

Gilihalki has a particular fondness for his family's vegetable garden. He often spends time there, helping his mother tend to the plants and vegetables. It reminds him of the importance of community and self-sustainability in their precarious existence.
Gilihalki Tyaruil.description: Gilihalki Tyaruil is a 25-year-old male human who works as a senior guard for The Guardian Corps in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. He is a brave and skilled warrior who takes his job very seriously, willing to protect his community with his life if necessary. Gilihalki comes from a native family that consists of his father Trynyn, his mother Feraro, his eldest sister Nuiss, his younger sister Relyth, his eccentric aunt Jaer, his rebellious cousin Theradarsha, and his innocent grandchild Feraibrar. Gilihalki has always had a close bond with his family, particularly with his younger brother who he looks after and protects. He is respected and admired by his family members, especially his younger brother.

family.relationship: respected and admired by his family members, especially his younger brother

Gilihalki Tyaruil.habits: Gilihalki is a disciplined individual who has strict habits. He wakes up at dawn and starts his day with a rigorous training session to maintain his physique and combat skills. After training, he has breakfast and checks the equipment and tools he needs for his guard shift. During his shift, he is focused and alert, making sure that everyone in the community is safe. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his family, particularly his younger brother. He also enjoys reading books about the old empire and honing his combat skills.
Gilihalki Tyaruil.history: Gilihalki was born and raised in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. He grew up surrounded by the hauntingly beautiful landscape and the communal bonds of his family and neighbors. His family members were all strong and resourceful individuals who taught him how to survive in this precarious existence. When Gilihalki was 16 years old, he joined The Guardian Corps and was trained as a guard. He quickly rose through the ranks due to his skill and determination and became a senior guard at the age of 23. Gilihalki has always been proud of his native heritage and has a deep respect for the lost civilization that once inhabited this forgotten realm.

job.description: Brave and skilled warrior
job.quote: "I will protect this community with my life."
job.relations: Is fiercely loyal to The Enclave and has a particularly close bond with Atri'Garvanavia and Yaraeeae Koeheruil.

Gilihalki Tyaruil.name: Gilihalki
plot: Gilihalki discovers an ancient map that leads to a lost ruin on the unique continent, and he becomes determined to explore it. However, he must navigate treacherous terrain and avoid dangerous creatures to reach the ruins.

The Enclave is threatened by a mysterious illness that has started to infect the inhabitants. Gilihalki takes it upon himself to investigate and find a cure, even if it means traveling to dangerous places outside The Enclave.

Gilihalki's younger brother gets involved in a dangerous situation, and Gilihalki must risk his life to save him. However, he soon realizes that his brother's predicament is part of a larger plot that threatens The Enclave as a whole.

A new group of travelers arrives in The Enclave with the promise of trade and prosperity. Gilihalki becomes suspicious of their intentions and starts to investigate, uncovering a web of deceit and danger that threatens the community.
Gilihalki Tyaruil.quote: "I will protect this community with my life."
Gilihalki Tyaruil.relations: Is fiercely loyal to The Enclave and has a particularly close bond with Atri'Garvanavia and Yaraeeae Koeheruil.

relationship.Atri'Garvanavia: Gilihalki has a close working relationship with Atri'Garvanavia, who is a skilled scout and leads patrols for The Guardian Corps. They have a mutual respect for each other and have worked together on several occasions to protect The Enclave.
relationship.Feraro Tyaruil: Gilihalki has a deep respect and love for his mother, Feraro, who is the family head and a strong-willed and protective figure in the family. He looks up to her and often seeks her advice when faced with difficult decisions.
relationship.Jaer Tyaruil: Gilihalki's eccentric aunt, Jaer, is an unconventional and free-spirited individual who often surprises Gilihalki with her antics and ideas. Although he sometimes finds her behavior strange, he loves his aunt and appreciates her unique perspective on life.
relationship.Nuiss Tyaruil: Gilihalki's eldest sister, Nuiss, is responsible and hardworking, always looking out for others. Gilihalki has a close bond with her and often relies on her support and wisdom.
relationship.Relyth Tyaruil: Gilihalki's younger sister, Relyth, is an artistic and sensitive teenager. Although they have different interests, Gilihalki is supportive of his sister and often encourages her to pursue her passions.
relationship.Theradarsha Tyaruil: Gilihalki's cousin, Theradarsha, is a curious and carefree individual who loves exploring the ruins around The Enclave. Gilihalki admires his cousin's adventurous spirit but also worries about her safety and often tries to keep an eye on her when she goes on her expeditions.
relationship.Yaraeeae Koeheruil: Gilihalki also has a close relationship with Yaraeeae Koeheruil, who is a scavenger and a boss at The Guardian Corps. She is ambitious and respected and is seen as a future leader of The Enclave. Gilihalki has worked with her on several occasions and admires her leadership skills and determination.

anecdotes: Jordan once saved a young trader's life by applying a plant remedy she had collected in the forest. The trader had come down with a mysterious illness that no one could cure, but Jordan knew just what to do.
Jordan has been known to go on long walks in the nearby forest to clear her mind and seek guidance from the spirits. She always returns with a renewed sense of purpose.
Once, during a particularly harsh winter, Jordan led an effort to collect firewood for the entire enclave. Her efforts kept everyone warm and fed, despite the precarious existence of the group.
Jordan Hurst.clothes: flowing white robes with a red sash
Jordan Hurst.description: Jordan Hurst, also known as The Wise One, is a kind and wise matriarch of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. With short salt-and-pepper hair worn in a bun and radiant wrinkled skin, she stands short but commands respect from all who know her. She has been a respected member of the community for decades, advising younger traders and helping to build up The Hopefuls' Alliance. Despite her husband's past as a slaver, Jordan is known for her resilient and compassionate nature. She is a spiritual person and deeply believes in the local non-gendered deity, which is unique to this forgotten realm. Jordan wears flowing white robes with a red sash, adding to her hauntingly beautiful appearance.

family.relationship: matriarch of the group

Jordan Hurst.habits: Jordan habitually wakes up early every day to meditate and pray. She spends her days trading goods with other communities, mainly food and supplies, and then returns to her home in the evening to advise and mentor younger traders. Jordan also takes time to visit the sick and injured in the enclave, offering spiritual guidance and healing using herbs and plant remedies she collects in the surrounding forest.
Jordan Hurst.hair: short salt-and-pepper hair, worn in a bun
Jordan Hurst.history: Jordan Hurst came to The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones as an outsider many years ago, seeking refuge after her husband's past as a slaver was discovered by their previous community. Despite initial distrust, Jordan quickly gained the trust of the people here with her kind and wise demeanor. Over the years, she has helped to build up The Hopefuls' Alliance into a prosperous trading co-op and has become a matriarch of the group with her spiritual guidance and mentoring. Jordan's life has not always been easy, but her resilience and perseverance have allowed her to overcome many obstacles.

job.description: kind and wise, a respected member of the community
job.quote: "I've seen this co-op grow for decades. We're in good hands"
job.relations: advising younger traders

Jordan Hurst.name: Jordan
plot: Jordan's spiritual beliefs often come into conflict with the local beliefs of the big empire that surrounds the enclave. This could lead to a potential plot where Jordan must convince outsiders of the validity of her non-gendered deity.
Jordan's husband's past as a slaver could come back to haunt her and threaten her standing in the enclave if it were to be discovered by someone from outside the group.

As a senior member of the community, Jordan is getting older and may soon need to pass on her wisdom and mentoring role to someone else. This could lead to tension between the younger and older members of the enclave.
Jordan has always been curious about the lost civilization that once occupied this area and could be motivated to embark on a quest to gain more knowledge about it.
Jordan Hurst.quote: "I've seen this co-op grow for decades. We're in good hands"

relationship.Bors Ashcroft: Jordan respects Bors for his practicality and gruff nature, but does not always see eye-to-eye with him. She sometimes finds him too strict with the younger members of the enclave.
relationship.Darlave Softshadow: Jordan has a great deal of respect for Darlave, who is the boss of The Hopefuls' Alliance and a seasoned trader. She often seeks out his advice on matters of business and trade.
relationship.Juliana Fullet: Jordan has a deep connection with Juliana, the wise and loving matriarch of the living group with origins as outsiders. They often discuss matters of spirituality and the importance of communal bonds.
relationship.Niall Vain: Jordan has a close relationship with Niall, another senior trader in The Hopefuls' Alliance. The two often work together on trading missions and offer spiritual guidance to each other.

Jordan Hurst.secret: her husband was once a slaver
Jordan Hurst.short_description: kind and wise, a respected member of the community

anecdotes: Once when a harsh winter storm destroyed most of the crops in the family's garden, Juliana worked tirelessly with her grandchildren to scavenge for edible plants in the surrounding forest. They managed to find enough food to last them until the next planting season.

Juliana once taught an apprentice trader at The Hopefuls' Alliance how to make a special dish that is unique to their native culture. This dish has become a staple for many communal meals and has helped bring the community together.
Despite her age, Juliana still likes to dance during communal celebrations. Her graceful moves have earned her the nickname 'The Dancing Cook.'
Juliana Fullet.description: Juliana Fullet is a wise and loving matriarch of the Fullet family, one of the few remaining native families in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. Despite her age of 65, Juliana remains an active member of the community and works as a trader at The Hopefuls' Alliance. Her skills in cooking have made her the go-to person when it comes to preparing communal meals for the family and the co-op. Her hospitality, intuition, patience, and wisdom make her respected by all family members and her colleagues at work. Although she appears old, her hazel eyes still radiate warmth that reflects her loving and caring nature. She dresses in plain linen dress and wears a silver hairpin on her short grey hair. Despite the precarious existence of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, Juliana remains resilient, resourceful, and hopeful that her people will thrive despite their isolation.

family.relationship: respected by all family members

goals: finding a way out of the enclave
Juliana Fullet.habits: Juliana wakes up before sunrise every day to either tend to the family's garden or prepare food for the communal meal. She is meticulous in planning the meals and ensures that everyone gets their fair share. Juliana enjoys spending time with her grandchildren and teaching them about local beliefs and the spirit of the single god. In her free time, Juliana prays to a deity that is different from the one worshipped by most inhabitants of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones.
Juliana Fullet.history: Juliana was born as Vain, into a family that has lived in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones for generations. Her family was one of the few that never migrated from the enclave despite the precarious existence and the constant scavenging for resources. Juliana married Barlowe Fullet, the current family head, and helped him raise their children, Cacey and Gale. She taught them the art of cooking and instilled in them the importance of communal bonds. As she grew older, she became wiser and more patient, earning the respect of everyone around her. Her secret prayer to a different deity has been with her for years and was passed down to her by her own grandmother.

job.description: wise and loving matriarch
job.quote: "Cooking is the glue that keeps this community together"
job.relations: preparing communal meals

Juliana Fullet.name: Juliana
plot: Juliana discovers a rare ingredient in the forest that could turn the fortunes of The Hopefuls' Alliance, but she needs to convince her colleagues to go on a dangerous journey to retrieve it.

The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones is threatened by the undead, something that Juliana has never encountered before. She must use her wisdom and knowledge of local beliefs and the spirit of the single god to protect her family and the community.

Juliana discovers a lost relic from a long-forgotten civilization that could help answer some of the mysteries surrounding The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones and her native culture. But she must decide whether to share this knowledge with the wider community or keep it to herself and her family.

The Hopefuls' Alliance is faced with a rival co-op that wants to take over their market share. Juliana must use her cunning and resourcefulness to help protect the livelihoods of her colleagues and ensure that the co-op remains prosperous.
Juliana Fullet.quote: "Cooking is the glue that keeps this community together"

relationship.Barlowe Fullet: Juliana respects her husband and has stood by him for years as he led the family through many hardships. She is also grateful for the children they raised together, and she tries to instill in them the importance of family and communal bonds.
relationship.Brunner Fullet: As Juliana's grandson, Brunner represents the future of the family, which gives Juliana hope for their survival. Juliana enjoys spending time with Brunner and teaching him about the local beliefs and the spirit of the single god.
relationship.Cacey Fullet: As the youngest son and an ambitious young man, Cacey looks up to his grandmother Juliana for guidance and wisdom. Juliana is proud of Cacey's determination and resourcefulness, even though they have different ideas about how to make The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones thrive.
relationship.Darlave Softshadow: Darlave is Juliana's boss at The Hopefuls' Alliance, and Juliana respects her for her knowledge and experience in the trade. Juliana often collaborates with Darlave to prepare food for the co-op's communal meals.
relationship.Gale Fullet: As the eldest daughter and a strong young woman, Gale shares much of Juliana's charm and determination. Juliana sees a lot of herself in Gale and hopes that Gale will continue to be a driving force for preserving native culture and promoting communal bonds.
relationship.Geduve Steadfast: As the leader of the co-op, Geduve is responsible for ensuring that The Hopefuls' Alliance remains prosperous. Juliana respects Geduve's leadership skills and recognizes the importance of a strong and stable co-op in the fragile existence of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones.
relationship.Una Bradner: As a senior trader at The Hopefuls' Alliance, Una and Juliana have worked together for years. Juliana admires Una's toughness, intelligence, and resourcefulness.

Juliana Fullet.secret: secretly prays to a different deity

anecdotes: Kade once got into a brawl with a group of scavengers who had been stealing supplies from The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. He emerged victorious but was banned from the local tavern for a month as punishment.
Kade once made a suit of armor for his daughter, Dara Tolbert, that was so well crafted it sold for a high price in a neighboring town.
Kade has a tattoo of a dragon on his right hand that he got to symbolize his desire for adventure and freedom.
Kade Tolbert.description: Kade Tolbert is a hot-tempered and impulsive man who dreams of adventure and riches. He is proud of his blacksmithing skills and often boasts about them, while also being quick to anger when something goes wrong. Kade loves his family but can be neglectful at times due to his desire for adventure. He secretly wishes he could leave The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones and never look back. Despite this, he is a valuable member of the community due to his expert blacksmithing abilities.

family.relationship: loves his family, but can be neglectful

Kade Tolbert.habits: Kade is a hard worker, spending most of his time in The Tolbert Foundry crafting weapons and armor. He enjoys a good fight and will often get into arguments with other inhabitants of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. He is known to act first and think later, which can lead to reckless behavior. Kade also has a tendency to drink heavily when he is feeling down or frustrated.
Kade Tolbert.history: Kade was born and raised in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, where he learned the art of blacksmithing from his father and foreman, Boren Tolbert. He has always dreamed of leaving the enclave to explore the world and make a name for himself. However, he has never been able to bring himself to actually leave. Kade has a rebellious streak and often clashes with authority figures. Despite this, he has a deep love for his family and respects their traditions.

job.description: hot-tempered and impulsive man who dreams of adventure and riches
job.quote: There's nothing that can't be fixed with a hammer
job.relations: Barks orders and boasts about his skills, but respects his family members

Kade Tolbert.name: Kade
Kade Tolbert.physical detail: a tattoo of a dragon on his right hand
plot: Kade's desire for adventure finally gets the best of him, and he leaves The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones in search of treasure and fame. However, he soon realizes that the world outside is much more dangerous than he anticipated and must fight to survive.

Kade's pride gets the better of him, and he enters into a bet with a rival blacksmith that he can craft a sword so fine it will sell for five times its normal price. However, in his rush to complete the sword, he makes a mistake that nearly costs him everything.

Kade discovers a secret passage beneath The Tolbert Foundry that leads to a long-forgotten treasure trove. However, he must navigate dangerous traps and overcome fierce guardians to claim the treasure for himself.

Kade's neglectful behavior towards his family catches up with him when his daughter, Dara Tolbert, goes missing. He sets out on a perilous journey across the wilderness to find her before it's too late.
Kade Tolbert.quote: There's nothing that can't be fixed with a hammer
Kade Tolbert.relations: Barks orders and boasts about his skills, but respects his family members

relationship.Boren Tolbert: Kade respects and looks up to his older brother Boren, who is set to inherit The Tolbert Foundry after their father retires.
relationship.Dara Tolbert: Kade loves his daughter deeply and is proud of her energy and curiosity. He hopes to pass on the art of blacksmithing to her one day.
relationship.Derry Tolbert: Kade loves his wife Derry but struggles to balance his desire for adventure with his responsibilities as a father and husband. He often neglects her and fails to see the struggles she faces due to poverty and disease.
relationship.Muriel Tolbert: Kade loves and cares for his grandmother Muriel, who has always been a source of comfort and support for him.
relationship.Perth Tolbert: Kade has a deep respect for his grandfather Perth and often seeks his wisdom when he is feeling lost.

Kade Tolbert.secret: he secretly wishes he could leave The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones and never look back
Kade Tolbert.short_description: hot-tempered and impulsive man who dreams of adventure and riches

anecdotes: Kearey once saved a young child from drowning during a flood, despite her fear of water.
When scavengers attacked the group, Kearey led a successful defense and earned the respect of many members.
Kearey Bainbridge.clothes: long skirts with a blouse and shawl
Kearey Bainbridge.description: Kearey is a wise matriarch who holds The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones together. Despite her age, she still works as a watch and is highly respected for her skills and experience. She is known for her patient and traditional nature, and her resilience in the face of the precarious existence of the group. Kearey's blue eyes and short curly grey hair make her stand out in the hauntingly beautiful landscape of the forgotten realm. Her scar above her left eyebrow is a reminder of the dangers that she has faced. She wears long skirts with a blouse and shawl during her daily tasks and leather armor and helmet (brown) when at work for The Guardian Corps. Kearey is a key figure in the group and is commonly referred to as Commander Kay among its members. She lives in the family_type group with Delaney Keller and Victor Ironside, who she cares deeply for.

family.relationship: highly respected

Kearey Bainbridge.habits: Kearey has a habit of preparing herself mentally and physically for the worst, which has helped her survive in the isolated and dangerous environment of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. She spends a lot of her free time reading and studying to expand her knowledge and improve her skills. Despite her fear of water, she makes sure to always stay hydrated and encourages others to do so as well.
Kearey Bainbridge.history: Kearey came to The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones as an outsider, but quickly became a prominent member of the community due to her skills and leadership. She joined The Guardian Corps and worked her way up to become the boss of the watch. Kearey has lived through multiple crises in the group, including attacks from scavengers and natural disasters. She has always been able to keep the group together by relying on their communal bonds and the strong belief in a single, non-gendered deity. Kearey's goal is to ensure the safety and prosperity of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones while passing down her knowledge to future generations.

job.description: Wise matriarch who holds group together
job.quote: "Prepare for the worst, but hope for the best."
job.relations: Has good relationships with most members of the group, but can be tough on those who don't pull their weight.

Kearey Bainbridge.name: Kearey
Kearey Bainbridge.physical detail: a small scar above her left eyebrow
plot: Kearey has heard rumors of a lost civilization beyond the precarious borders of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. She may be interested in exploring this new territory to expand the resources and knowledge of the group.
A mysterious illness has started to affect some members of the group. Kearey may take it upon herself to find a cure or prevent further spread of the disease.
The Guardian Corps has received reports of an upcoming attack from a nearby group of scavengers. Kearey must lead the defense of the Enclave and rally the community to face this threat.

An artifact from the unique continent has been found, and it may hold the key to unlocking more knowledge about the group's non-gendered deity. Kearey may want to investigate this artifact and its potential significance for the community.
Kearey Bainbridge.quote: "Prepare for the worst, but hope for the best."
Kearey Bainbridge.relations: Has good relationships with most members of the group, but can be tough on those who don't pull their weight.

relationship.Atri'Garvanavia: Kearey has a lot of respect for Atri'Garvanavia due to their sharp and calculating mind, and often works closely with them during patrols.
relationship.Caylan Keller: Kearey sees Caylan as a kind grandmother figure who is always willing to listen and tell stories to boost morale among the group.
relationship.Delaney Keller: Kearey sees Delaney as a nurturing and charismatic presence in the family_type group, and relies on her to keep everyone together and in good spirits.
relationship.Enda Mallett: Kearey values Enda's wisdom and experience, often seeking her advice during difficult times.
relationship.Fitch Brisbane: Kearey is impressed by Fitch's resourcefulness as a scavenger and hopes that he will continue to contribute to the group in the future.
relationship.Galt Brisbane: Kearey sees Galt as a sensitive and artistic young boy who has the potential to become a valuable member of the community.
relationship.Latenspar Koeheruil: Kearey enjoys seeing Latenspar play and is often reminded of the importance of keeping the community safe for future generations.
relationship.Vetta Wroughthammer: Kearey has had disagreements with Vetta in the past due to their outspoken and strategic nature, but ultimately respects her contributions to the group.
relationship.Victor Ironside: Kearey cares deeply for Victor, who she sees as a potential future leader of the group due to his analytical mind and persistence. She often seeks his advice and values his opinions.
relationship.Yaraeeae Koeheruil: Kearey recognizes Yaraeeae's potential as a future leader of The Guardian Corps and has become a mentor figure for her. She is ambitious and respected among the group.
