anecdotes: Yaraeeae once joined a scavenging expedition beyond the borders of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, and narrowly escaped an encounter with a group of bandits.
As a child, Yaraeeae was very competitive and would often challenge his siblings and cousins to games and competitions.
Yaraeeae is a talented musician and often plays the lute in his free time.
Yaraeeae Koeheruil.clothes: fitted shirt and trousers with a leather vest
Yaraeeae Koeheruil.description: Yaraeeae Koeheruil is a half-elf with short and styled black hair and hazel eyes. He is of middle age and has an average physique. Yaraeeae is ambitious and aspires to someday lead The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, which is his home. He is respected by most members of his community and gets along well with them, but can be competitive at times. Yaraeeae works as a scavenger in The Guardian Corps, which is responsible for the defense of the community.

family.relationship: Expects to become the successor of his father Naral

Yaraeeae Koeheruil.habits: Yaraeeae takes his duties as a scavenger and potential future leader of the community very seriously. He is a sharp and confident individual who is always ready to take on new challenges. Yaraeeae is an avid reader and enjoys spending time alone to contemplate his future goals and aspirations. He is also very organized and makes sure that he has a clear plan before he undertakes any task.
Yaraeeae Koeheruil.history: Yaraeeae comes from a family of scavengers who have been living in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones for generations. His father, Naral, is a beloved leader and skilled warrior in the community, while his mother passed away when he was young. Yaraeeae grew up with his younger siblings and cousins in a tight-knit family group consisting of mostly natives. He was always a curious and ambitious child, and was determined to make a name for himself in the community. As he grew older, Yaraeeae's ambitions only grew stronger, and he became more and more involved in the affairs of The Guardian Corps. He has worked hard to gain the respect of his colleagues and fellow community members, and hopes one day to take on the role of leader.

job.description: Ambitious and respected future leader
job.quote: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts."
job.relations: Aspires to someday lead The Enclave and gets along well with most members, but can be competitive at times.

Yaraeeae Koeheruil.name: Yaraeeae
plot: Yaraeeae's father, Naral, is getting older and may soon retire from his position as a leader in the community. Yaraeeae sees this as an opportunity to prove himself as a capable leader and gain the respect of his fellow community members. However, there are other contenders for the position who may not be as willing to give up without a fight.

Yaraeeae's ambitions have led him to become somewhat isolated from his family group and other members of the community. He must balance his desire for success with the need for communal bonds and a sense of belonging.
Yaraeeae's secret lack of belief in the religious customs of the community could cause problems if it were to be discovered. He must navigate this delicate situation carefully.
Yaraeeae's job as a scavenger in The Guardian Corps puts him in danger on a regular basis. He may have to make difficult decisions in order to protect himself and his colleagues.
Yaraeeae Koeheruil.quote: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts."
Yaraeeae Koeheruil.relations: Aspires to someday lead The Enclave and gets along well with most members, but can be competitive at times.

relationship.Atri'Garvanavia: As a senior scout in The Guardian Corps, Atri'Garvanavia is one of Yaraeeae's colleagues. While they work well together, Yaraeeae sometimes feels overshadowed by Atri'Garvanavia's sharpness and calculating nature.
relationship.Azaselin Koeheruil: As the youngest son of Yaraeeae's family group, Azaselin often feels misunderstood and left out. However, Yaraeeae tries to make an effort to include him in community activities and support him whenever he can.
relationship.Cecily Brisbane: As the leader of The Guardian Corps, Cecily and Yaraeeae work closely together. While Yaraeeae respects her as a leader and colleague, he also sees her as a potential rival for leadership of the community.
relationship.Kearey Bainbridge: As the wise matriarch of Yaraeeae's family group, Kearey is a respected voice in the community. Yaraeeae looks up to her and often seeks her advice on various matters.
relationship.Naral Koeheruil: Yaraeeae has a close relationship with his father, who is also a respected leader in the community. Naral has always supported Yaraeeae's ambitions and believes that he will one day make a great leader himself.

Yaraeeae Koeheruil.secret: Yaraeeae doesn't believe in the religious customs of the community

Rusty Raiders.anecdotes: 1) Once, the Rusty Raiders discovered a cache of ancient artifacts deep within the ruins. They worked together to extract the valuable resources, but in doing so they attracted the attention of a group of raiders who sought to steal their find. The Raiders defended themselves bravely and drove off the attackers, but not before suffering significant losses. 2) During one particularly harsh winter, the Rusty Raiders were forced to ration their supplies of food and water. It was a difficult time, but they pulled together and managed to survive until spring arrived. 3) When a group of traders arrived at the Enclave, the Rusty Raiders were instrumental in negotiating a fair trade deal that benefited both parties.
Rusty Raiders.customs: The Rusty Raiders are known for their memorial day for the lost civilization, where they gather to remember those who came before them. They also hold potluck dinners and daily communal prayer to the Old One, the non-gendered deity worshipped by the Enclave. Their ritualistic scavenging expeditions are carefully planned and executed in order to maximize their resources and minimize risk.
Rusty Raiders.desc: The Rusty Raiders are a group of 20 resilient and resourceful scavengers who live in The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. They are known for their skill at finding scrap metal and salvaging resources from the ruins of the lost civilization. Despite their precarious existence, they maintain communal bonds and a strong sense of identity as scavengers.
Rusty Raiders.history: The Rusty Raiders were founded shortly after the Enclave was established, by a group of young adventurers who sought to explore the ruins of the lost civilization. Over time, they became skilled scavengers and began to play a vital role in the Enclave's survival. Despite facing many challenges and setbacks, they have remained a close-knit community of scavengers.
Rusty Raiders.name: Rusty Raiders
Rusty Raiders.plot: The Rusty Raiders discover a valuable resource deep within the ruins of the lost civilization. However, they soon learn that they are not the only ones interested in this resource, and must defend themselves against raiders and slavers who seek to take it by force.. A new threat arrives at the Enclave in the form of a deadly illness that begins to spread among the community. The Rusty Raiders are tasked with finding a cure, but their search takes them deep into uncharted territory and exposes them to dangers they never could have imagined.. The Rusty Raiders must journey to a nearby trading post in order to acquire a vital resource for the Enclave. However, the journey is fraught with danger, and they must use all of their skill and resourcefulness to make it there and back alive.. A group of outsiders arrives at the Enclave, and the Rusty Raiders are tasked with showing them around and teaching them about the way of life in the community. However, the outsiders have their own agenda, and the Raiders soon discover that they may be in more danger than they realized.
Rusty Raiders.relationship: The Rusty Raiders have a close relationship with the rest of the Enclave, who rely on them for valuable resources and trade. The Enclave provides shelter and protection for the Raiders, and they work together closely to maintain their self-sufficient lifestyle.

The Lost City Ruins.details: ancient stone structures, overgrown with flora and lined with mysterious glyphs

The Scavenger's Den.details: a small natural opening, flickering with torchlight and filled with piles of scavenged goods

The Scrap Yard.details: a jumbled pile of rusted metal scraps and makeshift stations

timeline: ritualistic scavenging expeditions
fierce battles with raiders and slavers
discovery of a new trading partner
successful harvest from the freshwater spring
devastating flood destroys half of their shelters
harsh winter forces them to ration supplies

The Elder Council.anecdotes: Barl Wroughthammer once forged a legendary sword that was used to defeat a bandit warlord and secure The Enclave's safety for years to come.. Boren Mallett's farm is known for producing some of the best crops in the region, thanks to his tireless work and ingenuity.. Garrett Mallett's extensive knowledge of the community's history and traditions has helped guide the Elder Council through many difficult decisions.
The Elder Council.customs: The Elder Council plays a pivotal role in The Enclave's customs and rituals, helping to organize and oversee events such as the annual Memorial Day for the Lost Civilization and communal prayer to the Old One. They also hold regular meetings to discuss the community's needs and concerns and make important decisions that affect the entire community.
The Elder Council.desc: The Elder Council is a group of wise and experienced individuals who have dedicated their lives to the well-being of The Enclave. They are known for their fair decision-making, political savvy, and extensive knowledge of the community's history and traditions. The Council members are deeply respected by all residents and hold significant influence over the direction of the community.
The Elder Council.history: The Elder Council was founded shortly after The Enclave's establishment, with its first members being the most respected and knowledgeable members of the community. Over time, the Council evolved into its current form, with five members selected to lead and guide The Enclave. Though there have been occasional power struggles and disagreements within the Council, the group has always remained a stable and integral part of The Enclave's survival.
The Elder Council.name: The Elder Council
The Elder Council.plot: The Elder Council must navigate a dispute between two factions competing for scarce resources, potentially leading to a violent showdown.. Betilda Mallett uncovers a conspiracy within The Enclave, forcing the Elder Council to launch an investigation and root out the traitors.. The Enclave is struck by a mysterious illness that threatens the entire community, forcing the Elder Council to embark on a perilous journey to find a cure.
The Elder Council.relationship: The Elder Council is highly regarded by all members of The Enclave, and its decisions are rarely questioned or challenged. The Council members work closely with the community's other leaders and officials, as well as with the occasional visitors from nearby trading posts or the empire. Though there have been occasional conflicts with bandits and raiders seeking to exploit The Enclave's isolation, the Council has always been successful in defending the community against these external threats.

The Great Hall.details: an impressive wooden structure with large beams, decorated with ornate tapestries. It houses long tables and benches where the Council of Elders gathers, and a large hearth provides warmth and creates a welcoming atmosphere.

The High Watchtower.details: a tall stone tower with commanding views of the surrounding mountains. The tower is fortified and well-maintained, with telescopes and instruments used to keep watch over the surrounding territory. The Elder Council frequently gathers here to plan and strategize.

The Old Temple.details: a half-ruined ancient stone temple with grand pillars, faded murals, and intriguing carvings. Despite its state of decay, it still exudes a hauntingly beautiful atmosphere and is considered a place of pilgrimage by some. Religious artifacts can be found scattered throughout the temple.

The Scrap Yard.details: an open-air storage area filled with a disorganized jumble of metal scraps. The Elder Council often gathers here to oversee the process of recycling and repurposing materials for the community's use. Fire pits and metalworking tools are scattered throughout the area.

timeline: Establishment of the Elder Council
Annual Memorial Day for the Lost Civilization
Devastating Flood and Rebuilding Efforts
Elder Council Election Dispute
Successful Defense Against Bandit Raids
Discovery of New Trading Partners

The Guardian Corps.anecdotes: 1. During a particularly brutal winter, the Guardian Corps kept watch over The Enclave day and night, braving the freezing temperatures to ensure their community's survival. 2. One Guardian Corps member refused to let a band of slavers take a young girl from The Enclave, standing his ground and driving them off with nothing but a hunting knife. 3. Kearey Mallett, the group's resident artist, once drew a breathtaking portrait of a group of Guardian Corps members standing watch atop The High Watchtower.
The Guardian Corps.customs: The members of the Guardian Corps hold themselves to a high standard of discipline and vigilance. They conduct daily training exercises to hone their skills, and hold an annual ceremony in remembrance of fallen comrades.
The Guardian Corps.desc: The Guardian Corps is a tightly-knit group of 19 individuals who work tirelessly to defend The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones from outside threats. They are skilled in surveillance and patrolling, and maintain a watchful eye on the community's surroundings to ensure their safety.
The Guardian Corps.history: The Guardian Corps was formed in response to repeated raids by bandits and slavers. The original members were handpicked for their combat skills and devotion to the community. Since then, the group has grown in size and reputation, becoming an essential pillar of The Enclave's survival.
The Guardian Corps.name: The Guardian Corps
The Guardian Corps.plot: The Guardian Corps leader falls ill, and a replacement must be chosen. A group of slavers are spotted nearby and the Guardian Corps must decide whether to confront them or retreat to protect The Enclave. A stranger arrives at The Enclave seeking help, but their true intentions are unclear and the Guardian Corps is tasked with investigating
The Guardian Corps.relationship: The Guardian Corps shares a close relationship with the rest of The Enclave, working closely with other groups to ensure everyone's safety. They are highly respected by the residents, who look to them as protectors and heroes.

The Armory.details: a large, dimly lit room with racks of weapons and armor along the walls

The Barracks.details: a large stone building with a sturdy gate and narrow windows

The High Watchtower.details: a tall tower with a spiral staircase and a telescope on the top floor

timeline: daily training exercises
annual memorial ceremony
successful defense against a bandit attack
flood damages barracks and weapons storage
patrol discovers new source of scrap metal

The Hopefuls' Alliance.anecdotes: During one of their scavenging trips, The Hopefuls' Alliance discovered a hidden trove of valuable relics from the lost civilization. They traded these relics for supplies that helped them maintain their self-sufficient lifestyle.. When the co-op was first founded, they struggled to gain the trust of the other residents of the enclave. However, their exceptional trading skills and resourcefulness earned them respect and admiration over time.. At a communal celebration of the Old One's blessings, the members of the co-op shared tales of their travels and adventures, inspiring younger members to set out on their own journeys.
The Hopefuls' Alliance.customs: The members of The Hopefuls' Alliance share a deep sense of communal bonds and loyalty to each other. They regularly participate in potluck dinners and daily communal prayer to the Old One. They hold scavenging expeditions to the ruins of the lost civilization, which they treat as a memorial day to the sacrifices made by their ancestors. The co-op is led by Geduve Steadfast, who is highly respected by the members.
The Hopefuls' Alliance.desc: The Hopefuls' Alliance is a tight-knit group of 20 traders consisting primarily of halflings and humans who work together in the Market Co-op. They are known for their exceptional ability to barter and trade with other small communities, and their resourcefulness in sourcing and dealing goods.
goals_keywords: finding a cure for an unknown illness
The Hopefuls' Alliance.history: Originally formed by a group of traders seeking safety from bandits and slavers preying upon isolated communities, The Hopefuls' Alliance quickly established itself as an important source of supply for The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. Over time, it became one of the most prosperous groups within the enclave. However, they faced many challenges, including a failed experiment with a despotic leader and a devastating flood that destroyed their shelters. Despite these setbacks, they persevered and remain a vital part of the enclave.
The Hopefuls' Alliance.name: The Hopefuls' Alliance
The Hopefuls' Alliance.plot: The members of The Hopefuls' Alliance must embark on a dangerous journey to establish trade relations with a nearby community. They must navigate treacherous terrain and deal with hostile bandits along the way.. An unknown illness is spreading rapidly throughout The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, and the co-op must work quickly to find a cure. They must trade with nearby communities for medicinal supplies and gather resources from the lost civilization ruins to create a remedy.. A group of slavers targets The Hopefuls' Alliance, hoping to capture and enslave the skilled traders. The co-op must defend themselves and drive off the attackers, potentially forming an alliance with other small communities under threat.. A powerful artifact has been discovered in the lost civilization ruins, and The Hopefuls' Alliance has been hired to retrieve it by a wealthy collector. However, they soon discover that the artifact is cursed, and must find a way to break the curse before it brings disaster upon the enclave.
The Hopefuls' Alliance.relationship: The members of The Hopefuls' Alliance are well-respected by the residents of The Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, who rely on them for much of their supplies. They have a mutually beneficial relationship, and many members of the co-op maintain close relationships with residents of the enclave.

Geduve's Office.details: a neat and organized room with maps and charts on the walls and ledgers and account books on the desk

Market Co-op headquarters.details: a bustling brick building surrounded by stacks of crates and barrels filled with goods

The Trading Post.details: a small rustic wooden booth surrounded by piles of crates and barrels

annual scavenging trip into the lost civilization ruins
communal celebration of the Old One's blessings
outbreak of an unknown disease
bandit raid on co-op's headquarters
rebuilding effort after a natural disaster

The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.anecdotes: During a particularly harsh winter, the Keepers' faith was tested as they struggled to find enough offerings to appease the Old One. They eventually turned to a band of outsiders for help and were surprised to find that they shared a common belief in the deity.. When a group of slavers attacked the Enclave, the Keepers rallied around Trynyn and managed to fend them off with just their faith and a few crude weapons. Their bravery earned them the respect of the other residents of the Enclave.. Nimimilavain Tyaruil, the oldest member of the Keepers, is known for her prophetic dreams. Her visions have helped the Enclave avoid danger and prepare for future challenges.
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.customs: The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity engage in daily communal prayer to the deity and perform ritualistic scavenging expeditions to gather offerings for the temple. They also organize potluck dinners and observe a memorial day for the lost civilization. In addition, they maintain a constant vigil at the High Watchtower to defend against bandits and raiders.
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.desc: The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity are a group of devout worshippers who maintain the Old Temple and tend to the spiritual needs of the Enclave. They are led by Trynyn Tyaruil, a respected family leader who ensures that the group's customs and rituals are upheld with utmost respect and devotion. The Keepers believe that the Old One will provide for them as long as they remain faithful and vigilant.
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.history: The Keepers were founded shortly after the Enclave was established. They discovered the half-destroyed temple to the Old One and repurposed it for their own use. Since then, they have dedicated their lives to worshipping the deity and preserving its legacy. They have faced their fair share of challenges, including dealing with a despotic leader and repeated raids by bandits and slavers.
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.name: The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.old_name: The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.plot: The Keepers discover an ancient artifact that could lead to the uncovering of the secrets of the lost civilization. One of the Keepers falls gravely ill, and the Enclave must seek outside help to find a cure. A band of raiders begins targeting the Enclave, and the Keepers must lead the defense against their attacks
The Pilgrims of the Forgotten Deity.relationship: The Keepers have a close relationship with the Enclave, providing spiritual guidance and support in times of need. They maintain a friendly but guarded relationship with outsiders, allowing occasional traders and visitors seeking shelter to enter the Enclave.

The Tolbert Foundry.anecdotes:
1. When Dara first joined the foundry, she was determined to prove herself as a skilled blacksmith. She spent countless hours studying and practicing, determined to become the best blacksmith in the family. After years of hard work, she finally succeeded, and her peers now regard her as one of the greatest blacksmiths in the region.
2. Kade, like many young men in the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, dreamed of adventure and riches. However, after his wife fell ill, he decided to stay in the enclave and help run the family business. Although he sometimes wonders what might have been, he knows that his duty to his family is more important than his personal ambitions.
3. Muriel once crafted a sword with such exceptional beauty and grace that it brought tears to the eyes of all who saw it. It is said that the blade was imbued with magic, and that it could cut through steel as if it were paper. The sword has since been lost to time, but its legend lives on.
The Tolbert Foundry.customs: The Tolberts take pride in their work and value honesty and integrity above all else. They have a strict code of ethics and will never create weapons for those who seek to use them for evil. Additionally, they hold an annual ceremony in honor of their ancestors, thanking them for passing down the knowledge and skills necessary to keep the family business thriving.
The Tolbert Foundry.desc: The Tolbert Foundry, nestled in the heart of the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones, is a family business that has been passed down from generation to generation. Known for their expertise in blacksmithing, they produce some of the finest weapons and armor in the region. The six members of the clan work tirelessly day and night to ensure that their clients receive only the highest quality products.
The Tolbert Foundry.history: The Tolbert Foundry was founded by Boren's great-great-grandfather over a century ago. Although the family has faced many challenges throughout their history, they have always managed to overcome them with their resilience and determination. Under Boren's leadership, the foundry has experienced a period of growth and prosperity unlike any other.
The Tolbert Foundry.name: The Tolbert Foundry
The Tolbert Foundry.plot: The Tolberts receive a request to craft a weapon for a mysterious traveler, but soon discover that the traveler has nefarious intentions.. During a routine supply run, the Tolberts stumble upon a hidden cache of ancient artifacts and must decide whether to sell them or keep them for themselves.. A rival blacksmith challenges the Tolberts to a competition to determine who is the best in the region.
The Tolbert Foundry.relationship: The Tolberts are respected members of the Enclave of the Forgotten Ones. They are often called upon to craft tools and weapons for the community, and they are always happy to oblige. Many residents of the enclave rely on them for their livelihood, as the tools and equipment they produce are essential for survival in the harsh mountain environment. In turn, the Tolberts rely on the community to provide them with the resources they need to continue their craft.
